name: df-ngp
body: |- wceq(cngp, crab(s0, cin(cgrp, cms), wss(ccom(cfv(cnm, cv(s0)), cfv(csg, cv(s0))), cfv(cds, cv(s0)))))
bodyPretty: ⊢ NrmGrp = { s0 ∈(Grp ⋂ MetSp)|((norm ` s0)∘(-g ` s0))⊆(dist ` s0)}
comment: Define a normed group, which is a group with a right-translation-invariant metric. This is not a standard notion, but is helpful as the most general context in which a metric-like norm makes sense. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2015.)
